means: 悉心照料，娇惯( coddle的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She coddled her youngest son madly.

list.exp: 生活优厚、过于娇惯的女子
list.abs: [coddled female] 生活优厚、过于娇惯的女子养尊处优的娇娇女也有烦腻的时候相关词语: 娇声娇喉娇奢娇小玲珑娇黄娇傲娇女娇殢娇艾娇啼娇态.

entry.def: To coddle someone means to treat them too kindly or protect them too much.

example.ex: She coddled her youngest son madly...
The warders' union has been denouncing the government for coddling prisoners.
example.tran: 狱警联盟一直谴责政府姑息犯人。

sentences.sentence: "pampered from earliest childhood, he believed the world had been invented for his entertainment"
